title: Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor on cream laid paper
inscribed: Below left, pen and brown ink: Les perances du Commerce. No. 99 99
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Base supported by tapered legs of descending concentric circles. Front panel decorated with festoons and ribbons flanked by anchors. Above, clock case at right, a child being rocked in a cradle by a woman, at left, carrying an anchor in her right hand. 

Inscriptions:
Below left, pen and brown ink: les perances du Commerce. No. 99 99

Below center: Cooper Union stampt #457D

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25.Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-16.
